metadata.title: CVE-2023-27533 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A vulnerability in input validation exists in curl <8.0 duringcommunication using the TELNET protocol may allow an attacker to pass onmaliciously crafted user name and "telnet options" during servernegotiation. The lack of proper input scrubbing allows an attacker to sendcontent or perform option negotiation without the application's intent.This vulnerability could be exploited if an application allows user input,thereby enabling attackers to execute arbitrary code on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-27533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm15
libcurl3 - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm15
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm15
libcurl3-nss - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm15
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: curl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm15').
